website_summaries.verdict: Portable and powerful grill that is perfect for tailgating.
pros: Folds up easily and pops back into working condition in a few easy steps
Features three burners with 3 adjustable temperature controls
Two sturdy side tables easily keep condiments, utensils, and more at the ready
cons: Any cooktop accessory has to be purchased separately and does not come with the set

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning the grill when your finished.
customer_reviews.text: Love the grill. It’s just a little messier to clean with a water pan. But I found a solution, grab the pan along the long edges and put your arms inside a large garbage bag and dump the water. Then wipe it clean afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Buku Raider

customer_reviews.title: I really like the features of this grill
customer_reviews.text: I really like the features of this grill, first time I washed it the paint came off the water pan, I called Coleman and they say Amazon must have sent me a used one, I'm sure that is not the case, sanded it off and repainted it with some high temp paint, I'm sure it will be fine but poor quality control on Colemans part
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this product zero stars I would. On first use, the handles of the pull-out table shattered leaving jagged and sharp edges. To make matters worse, Coleman does not provide replacement parts. In addition, the cover lock is incredibly in adequate. When rolling the stove, the cover lock will open with the slightest vibration allowing the cast iron grills and water tray to fall out. I am lucky that my grills did not shattered as noted in other reviews. I now use a strap when rolling the stove. Ridiculous for such an expensive grill, there are better options.
customer_reviews.author: GPH

customer_reviews.title: Buy the extra grill plates,watch the handles!
customer_reviews.text: Nice little grill. The bag is a bit tight. We've used it several (less than 10) times, packed it up and taken it camping etc., We went ahead and night the extra grill plates so we could have multiple uses. Love them too and would recommend. Yesterday we ran out of propane in our big grill mid-meal. We pulled this out and it worked great. I have one disappointment after pulling it out again the side handle fell off. I feel like this shouldn't have happened since we've used it so little and have always been very careful. They are grommeted on so I'm not sure how we'll fix it- maybe finding the perfect screws
customer_reviews.author: AZ

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable/ why the water filled ring under the grates?
customer_reviews.text: More of a convenience grille, acceptable for an occasional tailgate grille out. The water ring that needs filled turns into a nasty mess after a couple greasy burgers or sausage. Construction is adequate but the latch for the lid needs to be re-engineered....feels and operates like an afterthought. The new burner design does heat pretty even but could use a little more btu's. How about a storage spot for the propane bottle when not in use? Doesn't replace a a decent portable charcoal grille but the ease of propane saves this grille...barely
customer_reviews.author: annexab

customer_reviews.title: Evenly cooked, quick assembly
customer_reviews.text: This grill is great! It has three burners so the things that you are grilling does not cook unevenly. I purchased a 20lb to 1lb propane adapter and hooked up my 20lb propane to it. It is easy to assemble. I usually prefer a charcoal grill over propane, but this grill came close to giving me the charcoal grill taste, it did not disappoint me. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Jyno

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke in less than a month!
customer_reviews.text: When I first saw the grill it looked sturdy enough to move around, etc. At the end of the day it's for camping so you expect it to be like that. However after less than a month and after grilling 5 or 6 times, the right handle fell off completely. You need the handles to mount the grill up and bring it back down. They used rivet instead of screws and they are very poorly made. Another really annoying thing is that the handle take almost half of the table. You can barely fit a plate in there, it's something you can live with but it could have been definitely better designed.
customer_reviews.author: Helder Longo

customer_reviews.title: Worst Grill Ever??!!
customer_reviews.text: Although selection is somewhat limited with portable gas grills you would think the Coleman brand would offer a better choice than most but not in this case. It went together ok it is kinda sturdy, however in order for it to hold the water in the catch pan the grill has to be level, which was no easy task out doors. Heat distribution is horrible and the grill either burns or under cooks. I guess if you just want an easy to move and store portable grill and dont care about the quality of the food cooked on it, then this ones for you. If you care about your food, dont buy this grill.
customer_reviews.author: PJK

customer_reviews.title: Great grill!!!
customer_reviews.text: Really love this grill. Kind of odd that it doesn't have a greese tray. To clean. You have to take the grills off, and wipe out the entire under pan. Which is pretty easy. But not as easy as just removing a greace tray. Love the grill tho. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Manly Stuwart

customer_reviews.title: How did so many people like this grill?!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am amazed that anyone liked this grill. I found it to be poorly made and a bit of a hazard. The grill is very top heavy with loose metal pieces that rest in the grill. It is dangerous to try and move this grill when in use as the base collapses very easily. The lock closer is flimsy and ill fitting. I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Top broke after 3 uses, heavy, grease collector hard to move in a vehicle
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this item 2 months ago and have used it three times. The top of the grill is broken. Specifically, the small pins holding the hinge on the right side of the hood have failed. Very disappointing. As for being good for a road trip, I would not recommend it. The grease collector is a large metal insert that you need to add water to to collect the grease. You end up with a mess of grease floating on the water. This is not easy to travel with, in my opinion. We really liked older version of the RoadTrip grill but are thoroughly disappointed with this version.
customer_reviews.author: Reading Beast

customer_reviews.title: Poor design, far from a bbq
customer_reviews.text: Used 4 times. Only once used to grill meat (2 hamburgers) Easy to take tray out to clean. We used it once again with our cast Iron tray on top. It wouldn’t light and after investigating we found the orifice was full of oil and wouldn’t light again. We question regulator? This is supposed to be a bbq! Total rip off.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I was very upset to see that the shelves pictured on each side of the grill in the Amazon ad were not included. The carton had photos on all sides, depicting these shelves attached to the grill. I purchased this grill to be used in our Tailgate fundraiser for our kids programs in our small town library. These shelves should be sent to me ASAP without me having to pay more out of pocket. Our small organization looks foolish now that we put out fliers with the Amazon picture on them. Brenda Coates, President of Friends of The Essential Club Free Library. Canaseraga,N.Y.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Coates

customer_reviews.title: Just plan on removing the heavy grills removable when transporting.
customer_reviews.text: Like others posted before me; the lid latch works by catching on a piece of flimsy aluminum and therefore won't hold when transporting the grill. So out comes both heavy grates and the water tray waking up all within a 1/4 mile area. If that doesn't wake them your cursing probably will. I'm looking at way to fix that but will probably just use a bungee. Everything else looks good. I do like the cast iron grates. Much better than the porcelain coated grates cheaper grills use.
customer_reviews.author: Good to go!

customer_reviews.title: Broke first day.
customer_reviews.text: The lid to the grill broke off the moment I opened it. When I opened the box it was already damaged. Putting it together was easy but it isn’t the lightest portable grill. I will choose to fix it rather than return it seeing as how as I live on the 3rd floor and I refuse to drag it all the way back down and to the post office. I can live with the dents too.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney

customer_reviews.title: Great portable grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill will be a great addition to our camping gear. Very well made, simple 5 minute assembly and folds for transport easily. The only reason for 4 stars is when I tried it out we had very gusty winds and it had a little problem maintaining a constant temperature but with minor occasional adjustments cooked perfectly. I would recommend this grill to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Taebaker

customer_reviews.title: Not the best design. Stuff burns and sticks and is VERY hard to remove.
customer_reviews.text: I planned to use this grill as the occasional backyard grill to replace my little Weber and mostly for a decent portable grill for camping. I liked the 20,000 BTUs. But, It is wonky to move and stuff sticks to the grill. Sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: martini

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality construction, cheap hinges
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even get to try it out. As other reviews have noted, some of the construction looks and feels cheap. Three of the lid hinge rivets - the entire left side hinge - stripped the very first time we tried to open the lid while setting it up. Given that these are rivets and not screws I didn't want to go through the hassle of replacing them so we opted to return this model. I'm weighing giving it another chance and ordering another. Some people said that if the rivet pops it can be replaced with a brass screw and nut. I just wish the quality was sufficient out the gate to not have to worry about that.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan H

customer_reviews.title: Surprising good!
customer_reviews.text: We love the terrific searing you get with this little baby. Very compact, easy to minimize on a small deck. Yet works better than any large grill we've had for a lot of our grilling. Don't be put off by the need for propane canisters, there are converters available to let you fill the canister from a large tank, or you can get an adapter to attach a large tank (if you're going to keep the grill stationary.) We use the canisters, and found that one canister lasts a lot longer than the manufacturer suggests. Just be mindful of turning it off.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lovell

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for travel or home! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this grill. It has made our life so much easier not only for travel but at home as well. It is not the lightest thing to truck around(removing the cast iron grill plates helps though), but doesn't take up any uneccesary storage space in the bed of the truck or on the balcony. It is a great camping grill but has also replaced our grill at home, fitting on the balcony of our townhome much better. It burns strong and evenly, and you have a lot of control over the heat source and temperature. We are a Coleman family and this product lives up to the name.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Grillin'
customer_reviews.text: Easy to unpack and assemble. Love the 3 burners for varied cooking, heat generated and portability for small space storage. Learning curve needed for setting up and taking down unit in steps. Lid latch is next to useless causing grates to fall out. Had to tie a rope to secure the lid in order to roll across the lawn. Will adapt a more permanent latch solution later. Purchased a 4' hose adapter for about $25 and attached it to my 5 gallon refillable propane tank. Works great for a small grill.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Snow

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: Had high hopes for this grill after a lot of research. I needed something portable to carry in our class c motorhome and I don't want to sacrifice much other than cooking area. And I'm pleased with it. The grill gets plenty hot enough to sear and the thermometer seems to be fairly accurate. The slide out shelves are handy, and it's also a good looking grill. I have it hooked up via an extend-a-stay by Camco that allows us to use the propane right from the onboard tank as well as a portable 30lb. tank. I didn't want to mess with those little 1lb. tanks.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Bell

customer_reviews.title: Portable Cooking
customer_reviews.text: It was interesting to cook by first putting water inside the grill. The grease / drip pan requires about a pint of water prior to starting grill. This is suppose to keep your food from getting dry and assist in the cooking process. Unfortunately it also requires cleaning between cooking and is quite messy but relatively easy to clean up. If you are planning on using this with a RV low pressure gas line be warned that Coleman doesn't provide an easy way to bypass their regulator so will not work in that configuration.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Carter

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I had this product two weeks and the ignitor has went out already! We used it TWICE. I owned a Coleman travel grill before and this never happened. Now I have to manually light it and its practically brand new
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Merlo

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!!
customer_reviews.text: I like the style however the handle broke off after the first use. It was frustrating and when I called Coleman I received the run around. I would recommend something else
customer_reviews.author: Robert Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Rust out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived a few hours ago. Upon assembly I noticed rust already forming on the drip pan. Not light surface rust but a bubbled up metal section of deep rust. For the price and wait time of this grill I expected better. Hinges are also very flimsy as I've read other reviewers mention this issue. I feel if there was one quick swing of the grill door it would easily snap off. I'm delicate with stuff I purchase as I work hard for my $$$ but realize I might need to be extremely easy with the hinges.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Winter

customer_reviews.title: Achieves good temperature
customer_reviews.text: I bought primarily for the BTU's. One of the higher ones on the market. I got the pot rack for it. Cleaning is not real difficult. It is recommended to put water in the grease pan. I have used a fair amount and chose not too. It does collect a lot of grease but unless you let the level get real high, I don't see a problem with it catching fire. I like that it collapses and can be rolled in to a location or storage. Also, the fact that you do not have to put this on a table to use.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond C. Steinhart

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointing!!! Way too expensive for the junk. Dont Buy From Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.text: Complete Junk and the customer service suuuucks!!! The paint falls apart upon seasoning. On the outside also making it look crappy. Waste of money for something to fall apart. I can't even put food on the thing without worrying about eating a piece of it. Bern in contact with customer service for 3 weeks without any resolve. Very Disappointed!!! Update, now I cant even get a replacement shipped to my house. 3 times it has been lost in shipping. Do NOT buy from Amazon!!!
customer_reviews.author: T squared

customer_reviews.title: Great little grill
customer_reviews.text: I love this little grill. I have a large grill that I use for parties and when we have guests, but I just needed something small for when it's just our little unit. It was very easy to assemble, and it folds easily for transporting. I purchased the adapter to connect it to a full size tank for when we are using it on the deck. It's very easy to clean, and has a great non-stick surface. The grates are super heavy and very well constructed. Love this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Brou

customer_reviews.title: I would buy this grill again
customer_reviews.text: I don’t plan on traveling with this grill. I bought it for my backyard grill. I gave my big grill to my son and his family. I love this grill. It is light weight and easy to move around. It has an unusual feature that I’ve not seen before. You have to pour water in a water pan around the burners. After the grill cools, it’s messy and inconvenient to remove and get rid of the greasy water. Instructions say not to grill without the water. Something about keeping the temperature right. Otherwise, the grill is the greatest!! Yes, I would buy this grill again.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son for Christmas. He just finally put it together and the flame is 1/2". He can't even sear meat. I'm very disappointed and the thought of trying to box and return is daunting, if we can even still return it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Medart

customer_reviews.title: I only wish I’d bought it sooner!
customer_reviews.text: This grill is absolutely perfect. I only need one burner when cooking at home for me and the wife, but it can handle a large family cookout with ease. We take it with us in our RV and it’s easy to use, store and clean. I love the built in temp gauge on top. I really appreciate the details like the locking lid and stand. I just ordered the griddle insert for more breakfast cooking options. I’ve owned grills 3x times bigger and more expensive and they cannot compete with this efficient little grill!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great value, solid portable grill
customer_reviews.text: I love this portable grill. The cover is high enough to put a roast or a chicken on the grill top and close the lid. I also purchased the griddle and burner extras plus a cover. All a great quality. I had to wait a really long time after ordering (nearly a month), which was frustrating. The grill's drip pan is large and requires water, is awkward to empty due to it's size and the configuration of openings to accommodate the burners but if not emptied after use, rusts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cooks nice & hot
customer_reviews.text: I had an older version of this bbq for 10 years, it never was very hot & would take forever to cook anything. This one is a vastly different, a steak cooks very fast & it is so hot on full it is just way too hot. It is nice quality with the tray under the burner removable & the legs lock into place for moving when folded, nice additions with the newer model. I love it & will enjoy using it on the lower settings
customer_reviews.author: jfos

customer_reviews.title: Sent the wrong product?
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited to order this grill, but when it arrived today, it was not the one pictured or described. It didn't have the temperature gauge and only had 2, not 3 burners. I am sending it back, but what a pain. I had already started assembling it before I realized it didn't have the described features. I don't know what happened, but I'm going to head to a regular store to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: FeedbackfromCali

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, poor execution. Top won’t stay closed
customer_reviews.text: While the grill looks great, the usability is poop. I bought this as it’s easy to store in the stowage of my RV and I was hoping to be able to roll it to where I needed once removed. The latch system to keep the top closed is extremely useless and I am having to make a better device for keeping closed. Don’t expect to roll this grill and have the top stay closed, as it will not! This is a case of a good idea with horrible execution...
customer_reviews.author: OFF2FLY

customer_reviews.title: LID TO BAR B QUE DOESN'T CLOSE PROPERLY
customer_reviews.text: I purposely ordered the more expensive Coleman because I believed it to be better quality. The lid comes pre attached to the grill by rivets. After assembling the rest of the grill we now see that the lid is not properly riveted on the grill so it doesn't evenly close. There is about a finger gap on the right side. It's easy to see that the rivets are not lined up with the other side. Very shoddy product and easy to see. This should not of passed their quality control. Now we are apparently stuck with it because it says in the brochure we can only return it to Coleman and are responsible for the shipping to do so.
customer_reviews.author: Ruby

customer_reviews.title: Amazon messed up, but I am very happy with the product!
customer_reviews.text: The order clearly said BLUE, but the box said ORANGE. The grill inside was ORANGE. My family assembled it and cooked on it to surprise me, so I won't be returning it. Assembly was easy, all tools include. I read about the other reviewers having problems with the locks and the hinge on the back, but we did not feel as strongly as they did about those issues. Two meals cooked and more to come!
customer_reviews.author: Jan Marie G.

customer_reviews.title: Compact Grill PERFECT for Camping or Tailgating
customer_reviews.text: Like the integrated stand. No need for a picnic table or pickup tailgate. When folded up, it seems a bit loose fitting together, but it doesn't "fall apart". Just something to get used to. After use, the waterbath tray is a bit difficult to get out of the unit once filled with greasy water... (let cool completely) but there again, over time, I'm sure I'll develop a "system" for dealing with it. Looks to be fairly well made and hopefully it will last for many years. (it IS a bit pricey).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for tailgating
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this grill for cookouts with our son's baseball team. It was great. The only things we may not like the most is it seems hard to get the bottle of propane attached. Not sure if it's just ours and I hope it will get better over time, but my husband gave up and I finally got it to attach. It is a convenient grill that does a good job grilling and easy to open up and close down and travel with. Love the wheels. There is a little assembly needed when it arrives.
customer_reviews.author: Bright_Idea

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed! Lid hinges loose after a couple uses, latch won’t hold, started rusting after one week sitting in the garage. If I had kept the box I would have returned it
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Jones

customer_reviews.title: Flimsier Than Weber
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box there was a missing screw on one of the lid hinges. Also one of the other screws was missing it's nut. So lid was and is loose. I need to make a run to Home Depot to find tiny screws and nuts to replace what's missing. It works very well but probably won't last very long because it lacks the quality of a Weber BBQ at a similar price.
customer_reviews.author: speycast4steelhead

customer_reviews.title: Like it, but it could of used alittle more thinking in design
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the grill and would recommend it PROS: Cooks great fits perfectly in my RV storage love the temp gauge place to attach propane alot better lock latch on legs to help with transport three burner is awesome Cons: CLEANING always have to put water in tray to help with cleaning no place to hang utensils latch to lock lid is cheap. if you look at my pics. grease gets under the silver burners and hard to clean. if you bump the grill when water is in drip pan it will leak everywhere
customer_reviews.author: Tim P.

customer_reviews.title: Great small grill
customer_reviews.text: Being elderly, I only wanted a small grill that was easy for me to move and clean. I had to have a handyman put it together for me as I wouldn't have been able to lift it. It took him maybe 20 min. I've only used it once grilling spare ribs. It did a beautiful job. Cleaning the grate was a challenge because of the BBQ sauce but I think if I had used PAM for grilling prior to, it would have been fine. I'm hoping to do filet mignons on Friday. YUM
customer_reviews.author: patricia philpula

customer_reviews.title: Much Better than the older models. Coleman really improved on this Product 👍👍
customer_reviews.text: I owned this same product 6 years ago. I live on the coast and it rotted out after 4 years. I kept it covered after each use and I think that was the reason for it not lasting longer. Now as for the New Coleman Grill it’s of a much better quality 😋👍. It’s a thicker guage of steel 👍. I love it!! Definitely Bang for your buck! Great Item especially for tailgating, camping etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Rj Varnadore

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill, Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Grill!. I had bought the previous version (2015) and beat the heck out of it with an Overseas Move in the Military to Okinawa and held up like a champ. Bought this new one as it was time to let the other grill go and couldn't be happier. This model much easier to clean than the previous. Cooks quite a few items and does it well. So long to the big bulky grills as this one does well for a family of 4 and to entertain!
customer_reviews.author: BH_amazon

customer_reviews.title: Great portable grill!
customer_reviews.text: I had a small handle issue with the grill 6 months after purchase. Coleman stood behind their product!!! Their customer service was top notch! Our next grill will be another Coleman! It’s rare that a big company cares about your family’s planned camping trip but they took care of the issue very quickly and we are back to camping!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie Young

customer_reviews.title: Good grill for burgers, hotdogs, and fast cooking food.
customer_reviews.text: This grill isn't as easy to fold up or down as the adds seem to say. It is heavy! It also rolls when its folded. It has hot spots but once you grill a bit you work around them. Don't expect to cook a larger roast on it either. A two inch thick steak can be a challenge because it becomes very hot even at the lowest settings.
customer_reviews.author: R. Humphrey

customer_reviews.title: Use screws on all parts of grill
customer_reviews.text: Received grill with broken hinge. The metal fasteners used on hinges and handles are weak. They will break easily, I replaced with screws. Don’t understand why Coleman did not use screws on handles and hinges, poor engineering. I didn’t send it back due to me knowing how to fix it and making it more durable. I had read complaints from others having same problem within days or after several uses.
customer_reviews.author: Chico

customer_reviews.title: All set and ready to grill
customer_reviews.text: I had an earlier generation Roadtrip grill that I donated. Was still cooking, but wheel broken off and side tray cracked....it was time. Ordered the new version....bit pricey....with no sales promo. Assembly was easy, only additional comment on features is uncertainty on how the water tray will work. Will come back when I have some experiences.
customer_reviews.author: Ray DePalma

customer_reviews.title: JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: I’m honestly upset, the first time ordering the grill, it randomly went missing (so I didn’t have it for a camping trip). Got an replacement grill, had rust on it coming out of the box and then used “ONCE”!!! and the handle broke. In my opinion it’s overpriced/cheaply made junk. And for a 250 dollar price tag, really Coleman? I expected a lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Britnay W.

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from LX model
customer_reviews.text: I used to own the LX model years ago, I like the new features of this model, the always on stand is a big improvement from the LX as are the wheels. Perfect for tailgating and camping, or as an additional grill at a large party . The box arrived with several giant tears in it, I was very concerned about the grill being damaged or parts being missing. Turned out all was well. I have never received an item from Amazon is such deplorable shape..
customer_reviews.author: JerryB_NY

customer_reviews.title: NO FLARE UPS!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this grill a couple of times but have had no issues at all. I used an adapter to hose to hook it up to a 20lbs propane cylinder like your normal grill because I don’t like dealing with the small 1lbs tanks. The best part of the design is the grill plates and the burners. I love the fact that whatever your cooking doesn’t have the ability to drip grease on the burners and cause flare ups. That has always been my problem in the past using cheap tailgating/camping grills. They always flare up and cause concern for safety. Highly recommend this grill.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Not for rv
customer_reviews.text: Don't by this grill if you plan on hooking it upto your rv. This is the newer model with the integrated regulator where the controls are. Find a good used model with the regulator on the back of the grill and retrofit.
customer_reviews.author: jss

customer_reviews.title: Good grill.
customer_reviews.text: Good control of heat. 3 burners allow for various temps at once. I don’t understand why you are to put water in the tray below the burners, that really makes it a pain to clean after a camping trip. Side trays are ok, would be nice if they came out a little farther. Can barely get a standard plate on there.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: Buy an older model! This is trash.
customer_reviews.text: So this grill is different than the rest of the line and the manual is actually wrong, the venturi for plugged as they do and there is NO way to clean them and the manual was written for the old model. I haven't been able to use my grill all damn summer! Thanks for nothing Coleman!
customer_reviews.author: Olly

customer_reviews.title: Portable but food sticks really bad!!!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty cool little bbq ... can accommodate a good amount of food. But BEWARE ... FOOD STICKS TO THE SURFACE TERRIBLY and is impossible to clean. No amount of spray or oil seasoning will help this grill. Buyers beware !!!
customer_reviews.author: Paige

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for the beach.
customer_reviews.text: The grill is great for taking to the beach to cook just about anything. The lid is high enough that it can be shut with a cast iron pan on the grill. We made great breakfast burritos and yummy kielbasa for lunch. It is easy to operate and control the heat. I am looking forward to using it again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Sewjoy

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: I only used this product 5 or 6 times. When I tried to move the grill to store it in my garage as always do, the handlebars just riped off and the Grill fell into the ground. Cooks very well but the quality of materials is low. As you can see in the pictures, the rivets used to fix the handlebars just come out from the grill on both sides. In this price range, you can get better value with other brands.
customer_reviews.author: pablo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small family
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-designed-and-made grill. Light weight so easy to bring on weekend trips. Its grill plates may be too small for large parties or ten burgers at a time, but is perfect for small families. The grease tray is a big plus, making it much easier to clean than my old grill.
customer_reviews.author: Vermonter

customer_reviews.title: A Great replacement grill for two people
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. The three burners help grill food evenly along the entire surface. I bought the adapter so I could use a bigger propane tank. Works well. Wish it came with the flat grill and stove top sections for pots as well. (Can purchase separately). Overall, very pleased with our grill. This is our 3rd one!!
customer_reviews.author: Colohunter

customer_reviews.title: Cheap wheels, but excellent grilling
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this grill 5 months ago. After 5 months of using it, several times, I would give the grill 4 stars. My only complaint is with the wheels. I have seen better wheeks in toys. One of them broke the first time I rolled it across the driveway. I went to a store and bought lawn mower wheels, and some washers, to fix it. About $12 in upgrades and it works perfect. But Coleman could and should do better on the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Michael K Jones

customer_reviews.title: Camping was a Success
customer_reviews.text: We took this out for the first time for a 10-day camping trip. The Coleman was amazing! The only issue we had was the cable connecting to the #20 tank. It didn’t work. We had to use the #1 tank and worked like a charm. Even our teenagers grilled for the whole family. We grilled 4 large bone-in pork chops; 4-1/3 lb burgers; 2 bun length hot dogs; and, a kielbasa sausage all at the same time. It was awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: We love this grill. Heed the warnings of others and make sure you secure its lid with a strap. Otherwise, the latch could jar open and spill out the grill plates. It heats up fast, is well built and cleans up easy if you spray the drip pan with Pam. We have yet to fill it with water and doubt we ever will.
customer_reviews.author: Adam D. Orth

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is very heavy and it doesn’t lock very well. You can’t go wrong with Coleman. It works great and being on wheels does offset the weight, grates come out to clean so no problems there, I would recommend this. Just be careful to make sure the cover is really locked
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Great Grill, BUT the locking latch broke because it's weak!
customer_reviews.text: 4 Stars only because the latching lock is not strong. NEEDS TO BE Attached with sturdy bolts or screws. I was rolling the grill after 3 days of use and the door swung open and all the grill plates fell out. I reinforced them with a sees and nut! SEE PHOTOS!
customer_reviews.author: Acdlee, LLC

customer_reviews.title: Portable, Covenient, and Compact! Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this grill. We live in a small townhome and this is perfect for a family of 4. It's easy to collapse for transporting but still sturdy and well built. Easy to clean and works really well. I like that it has a temperature gauge on the hood! Definitely a must. For the price and the brand, this was a great buy! Would recommend to anyone looking to buy a grill either for a small apartment or small family or for camping. So happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Ordered the green color lid for the grill  but got orange instead!
customer_reviews.text: We need to use the grill tomorrow so have put it together tonight. Would have preferred the green Coleman Grill and am disappointed that I was sent the orange. On the plus side, the grill was easy to put together and am looking forward to a great dinner tomorrow night.
customer_reviews.author: jlnaga

customer_reviews.title: Not the qulity I expected
customer_reviews.text: Since the first review I've only used it a few times and the rivets on the lid hinges have popped, this thing is nearly new and it's coming apart. Yes there's a warranty but what it would take to send it anywhere would be a serious pain. I'll put screws and nuts in place of the rivets and hope that's sufficient.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Burger

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed for what I paid and would not recommend. Cons-For the money the rivets shouldn’t be loose and need replaced right out of the box. The paint on the top has changed colors from the heat after 2 uses. And there should be a lock when in upright position so can wheel around when upright. There is one for when collapsed. Pros- the burner responded quickly , we bought the full griddle and liked it.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!!
customer_reviews.text: The surface area is big enough to grill/ barbecue about 2 lbs of Chicken. And the heat component is fast. Didn’t appear I was using a portable gas grill... this thing heats up like a full-size one.
customer_reviews.author: raka

customer_reviews.title: No Gas
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we've owned. Our first one, two years ago (previous model), worked fine. This one seems to have no ability to create a flame/heat high enough to cook on. Scrambling eggs takes 15-20 minutes to heat the pan. I've followed the Coleman instructions to clear the line and reset the regulator, twice, to no avail. I'm not sure what to do, but I won't be ordering this model again.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Barnard

customer_reviews.title: The new burner design is not all that
customer_reviews.text: Coming from an older RoadTrip grill I really wanted to like this. We use one burner as a stovetop quite frequently while the other is grilling. Due to the design change, not all the heat is directed to the cookware above. We had to return it for that reason.
customer_reviews.author: Reza Raquib

customer_reviews.title: Too Heavy to travel with
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this item for camping, we found it too heavy and hard to stand up on its feet, very cheaply built, the lid lock did not work from the time it came out of the box (which they say is common), we got rid of it the first week.
customer_reviews.author: TimTam

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS THING
customer_reviews.text: GET ADAPTER SO YOU CAN USE 7 GAL PROPANE TANKS IT IS ENOUGH GRILL TO FEED 4 OR MORE PEOPLE. I USE IT ON MY PORCH AND WITH MY RV MOST OF THIS STUFF YOU MIGHT REPLACE RATHER THAN CLEAN, LIKE THE SPLASH SHIELD
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a while for a great grill. I discover this one and figured I would give it a try. The quality is amazing love how it folds down so it fits under the RV! Love the color and works amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Mickey

customer_reviews.title: Ideal balcony/patio grill
customer_reviews.text: Compact but does so much. We love this grill and how it folds up (including the slide-out shelves). We've been cooking on it constantly this summer and it doesn't take up too much room on our small balcony/patio.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney G.

customer_reviews.title: cleaning is sooo easy
customer_reviews.text: WE live in a condo and this is perfect for our patio. Had one before which we really liked but ended up leaving it uncovered for rainy season and pretty much ruined it. So glad because the new one has some features that make it even better in the way it is cleaned. Love the red color. Only problem is we haven't been able to make it lay flat which we need to contact company to find out what we did wrong. Definitely recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda

customer_reviews.title: Love this Coleman Grill
customer_reviews.text: Love this Coleman Grill! Easy assembly. Be prepared for a little bit of lengthy cleaning process. Food sticks on grill grates. Tried all pre-oil, spray and seasoning grates but everything sticks. Still love the grill!
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality parts
customer_reviews.text: While the grill itself works well. The poor quality parts and lack of response from the manufacturer. still waiting after 3 email using their for for warranty. As you can see the locking handle melted off. All I want is a replacement lock i will install it.One might question was the grill on to high of a flame.the answer is NO. I cannot recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: craig wyse

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic portable grill
customer_reviews.text: This grill was purchased to replace a much larger traditional grill , which was a pain to store and move around due to its size. That said this grill is almost perfect it can run off small propane bottles or connect to a larger 20lb bottle, it cooks the food evenly at almost all location of the cook top and the final result is well cooked food! The only dislike is the cleanup can be somewhat of a pain as you will need to empty the water reservoir and wipe down with soap and water after each use. Overall great option.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good bbq; didn’t like the grill plates
customer_reviews.text: Great bbq for on the go outdoors activities. I was looking for a small bbq for an apartment patio. Great heat and solid built bbq. I personally didn’t like the grill plates as it made it seem as if I was using a cast iron pan.m so I returned and went with another bbq.
customer_reviews.author: Dean S

customer_reviews.title: Top quality for Camping - Worth every penny !
customer_reviews.text: Spacious grill plates, top quality and wheels on bottom. The fact that it folds and lock easily is key to load it on a pickup truck or RV and it won’t open up during transport! Worth every penny !
customer_reviews.author: Andrés &  Mari

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill. One problem is that the side handle fell off as welds must have been weak. Now have to figure out how to get it fixed. Cooking surface is great and like that I can move it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Sbuckaroo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my deck at the campground
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something on wheels so I could move if I was having a party or if it was raining/snowing. This not only looks great it holds a lot! I bought the full size griddle and use it all the time for breakfast.
customer_reviews.author: Karen C

customer_reviews.title: Good grill.
customer_reviews.text: Set up the grill it's a nice for camping or for going out to a picnic site. Relatively easy to put together about 30 minutes out of the box. Right now I'm using it as my only backyard grill and it gets the job done. the blue flame is very hard to see in direct sunlight so it doesn't look like it's on.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Yates

customer_reviews.title: Use with gentle care
customer_reviews.text: Hood hinges are fastened to weak thickness metal of grill body. Side handle came apart during one time use. Quality control of manufacturing process and design of unit need to be re-examined. Closing latch of grill hood is flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for camping
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping and have had great luck. I also bought the griddle plates that you can swap out and use them all regularly. *Make sure you read directions. This model uses water in the base to help cook evenly. Works WAY better when you add it.
customer_reviews.author: JP NH

customer_reviews.title: Won’t fit road trip travel bag!
customer_reviews.text: I have not used the grill yet but it seams well made. But, the travel bag dose not fit. I spoke to Coleman it apears for now they don’t have any plans to make one. Update: Coleman dose not back this product with any spare parts. If anything breaks you are out of luck.
customer_reviews.author: Tim F.

customer_reviews.title: Great lil grill
customer_reviews.text: Awesome grill ... had to replace my older Coleman grill. This is a different design from the one I used to have... works just as well and the redesign took care of several issues I had w old design. Only issue a lil weird where u attach propane tank now but works great.
customer_reviews.author: Les Mas

customer_reviews.title: Nice product.
customer_reviews.text: Right-out-of-box dent (See picture) does not affect performance but unfortunate it wasn’t inspected better. Received it day before vacation began so not returned. Otherwise nice unit. A little expensive and other grill options are additional cost - they should come with this grill at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Almost a nice portable grill.
customer_reviews.text: At first glance, it is a very nice grill. Just what I wanted. Grilled great steaks the first night out. I folded it up to put it away and ...... wham! The door flies open and the grates fall out and break into pieces. The latch that secured the top is a wimpy and poorly designed. What good is a travel grill if it flops open during set-up, tear down or rolling ? Not sure how to replace a grate. Can’t really return it as I already bought all the accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Coleman cheaper out on the quality. But still cooks well.
customer_reviews.text: I would give 4-5 starts if this was built a little bit better. The first time I picked it up by the handle the handle broke off. It’s not a show stopper, but they used cheap rivets to attach the handle to the grill. The grill gets really hot and cooks well, just the over all quality of the product is not there.
customer_reviews.author: Traci E

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking grill, easy assemebly
customer_reviews.text: We live in an apartment condo, this is our second Coleman grill. We haven't used it yet but it sure looks good among the rest of our patio furniture. Will keep you posted on whether this grill holds up to our grilling standards. This is our second
customer_reviews.author: Karen Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Compact and perfect for tailgating
customer_reviews.text: Set up, ability to cook just about anything make this perfect for tailgating. Works well with small LP cans or large tank. Only reason for 4 stars: Would like to have an adjustable height. I'm tall and this is seemingly pretty short. Air gap between lid lets in to much air on a breezy day. Keeps on burning out. There are vents in the back that are more than adequate to allow for air movement. I'm overall very happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great grill for camping or even a day trip somewhere but as for cleaning it kinda sucks. I prefer an easier to clean grill than this one. Plus the lock for the lid can easily be opened while locked. (Yes I was able to verify it was locked)
customer_reviews.author: Justina Bruinekool

customer_reviews.title: Different
customer_reviews.text: The grill arrived with the metal, riveted on handle broken off. You have to fill the reservoir with water, then clean it afterward which is kind of a pain. Overall, it will work ok for us but not as nice as we expected.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Doty

customer_reviews.title: Great grill for our porch and trips to the mountains!
customer_reviews.text: Love this grill after the first few uses. Meat did stick after the first few times so I went and looked at the reviews to see if I should have seasoned the cast iron. Didn’t see anything but after using it probably 8 times, I rarely get anything sticking. I did oil the grill at first before placing meat on it but now I don’t even need to. It heats up so fast we don’t run through gas as fast as our last grill. We’ve taken it to cabins and it folds up fairly well.
customer_reviews.author: kathryn s. killion

customer_reviews.title: Best propane grill yet
customer_reviews.text: Love this. Had been using a Weber 2000 for years for the boat, camping trailer, etc (we use pellet grills exclusively at home). This thing rocks - gets up to 700 degrees, tons of power, 3 burners - can cook over indirect heat if desired. Grates come off easily to wash. I can't say enough good things about it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Traylor

customer_reviews.title: Cooked well!
customer_reviews.text: We were a little hesitant when we received it and saw that we needed to have a little water in the tray area under the grill. That said it worked well . We even purchased the griddle option and that was great for the breakfast options during our camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Howard

product_meta.title: Coleman RoadTrip 285 Portable Stand-Up Propane Grill
product_meta.description: The Coleman RoadTrip 285 Portable Stand-Up Propane Grill features sturdy quick-fold legs and 2 wheels for hassle-free setup, takedown, and transport so that taking your grill on a camping trip or to a tailgate is easy. Push the Instastart ignition button for matchless lighting, then select your heat with the enhanced temperature control of 3 independently adjustable burners (outer left, inner, outer right). With a range of grilling power from 3,250 to 20,000 BTUs and 285 sq. in. of cast iron grill grates coated in porcelain, you’ll wow your friends and family with an array of perfectly cooked meats, seafood, or veggies every time. If you're looking for more meal options, the Swaptop interchangeable cooktops let you switch the grill grates with a griddle or stove grate (both sold separately). With two sliding side tables to keep utensils and sauces handy, cooking with this grill is just as convenient as traveling with it. Bonus: The RoadTrip 285 Portable Stand-Up Grill can be stored upright (to fit in tight spaces) until your next cookout. Uses a 1-pound propane cylinder (sold separately).
feature_bullets: Up to 20,000 BTUs of grilling power and 285 sq. in. of cooking area
Now with 3 independently adjustable burners for enhanced temperature control
Assembled Dimensions: 45.6” D x 19.5” W x 35” H | Weight: 52.58 lb
2 durable side tables for resting utensils and sauces; integrated thermometer for accurate temperature monitoring
InstaStart ignition for push-button, matchless lighting
Water pan catches cooking grease and is removable for easy cleaning

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
